intro: Equilabium radiatum, commonly known as the radiate bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking visual appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is native to regions in Europe and western Asia. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Equilabium radiatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
